snippet: Stanley Schlein, a Democratic Party power broker, and his partners planned a lucrative housing development on their lot after keeping interested bidders out.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column examines 17-year lock on 2.3-acre vacant lot in the South Bronx, eyesore at 149th Street and Southern Boulevard, held by former Bronx Democratic Party power broker Stanley Schlein and two politically connected friends; says sorry tale of Schlein's refusal to develop the lot may soon end, as city plans to break ground on Crossroads Plaza, mixed-income residential and commercial development, on the site.
lead_paragraph: Stanley Schlein, a Democratic Party power broker, and his partners planned a lucrative housing development on their lot after keeping interested bidders out.

headline.seo: Insider Stanley Schlein Kept Right to Develop City Lot in Bronx for 17 Years
headline.main: For 17 Years, No Development as Insiders Held Rights to Bronx Eyesore
headline.print_headline: For 17 Years, No Development as Insiders Held Rights to Eyesore in Bronx

keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations
